caption:
This photograph captures a scene in a library card catalog room. The focus of the image is an older woman in the foreground, who is actively using the card catalog drawers. She is wearing glasses and a blue and white striped outfit and is flipping through a card catalog drawer that she has pulled out. Her expression is one of concentration as she searches for specific information.

In the background, another individual, a man, can be seen also using the card catalog. He is standing next to another row of file cabinets and appears to be either searching or writing something down.

The card catalog section of the library contains many rows of dark-colored wooden drawers, each equipped with a small label holder on the front for easy identification. Above these drawers are counters to place books or note-taking materials.

Further in the background, there are visible bookshelves filled with books, hinting at the extensive collection held by the library. This setting suggests a traditional library environment, focused on manual search methods before the widespread availability of digital catalog systems. The area is well-lit, promoting an environment conducive to reading and researching.
title: Librarian at the card files at senior high school in New Ulm Minnesota.  The town is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota.  It was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from europe.  Several manufacturing firms have located here since 1950 and have helped the town to grow.  The business district was revitalized during the 1960's with community effort
